document.discussion_title: Concho Resources’ (CXO) “Buy” Rating Reiterated at Morgan Stanley
document.topic_text: Tweet Morgan Stanley reissued their buy rating on shares of Concho Resources Inc. (NYSE:CXO) in a research report sent to investors on Tuesday. They currently have a $187.00 price target on the stock. In other news, Director Steven L. Beal sold 16,250 shares of Concho Resources stock in a transaction that occurred on Monday, June 6th. The shares were sold at an average price of $119.75, for a total transaction of $1,945,937.50. Following the completion of the sale, the director now owns 73,652 shares of the company’s stock, valued at $8,819,827. The transaction was disclosed in a legal filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which is accessible through this hyperlink . Several hedge funds recently bought and sold shares of the stock. State Street Corp increased its stake in Concho Resources by 131.7% in the first quarter. State Street Corp now owns 6,124,790 shares of the company’s stock valued at $618,850,000 after buying an additional 3,481,877 shares in the last quarter. Carmignac Gestion bought a new stake in Concho Resources during the second quarter valued at $209,179,000. King Luther Capital Management Corp increased its stake in Concho Resources by 10,148.1% in the fourth quarter. King Luther Capital Management Corp now owns 1,294,845 shares of the company’s stock valued at $60,456,000 after buying an additional 1,282,210 shares in the last quarter. Norges Bank bought a new stake in Concho Resources during the fourth quarter valued at $87,998,000. Finally, Capital World Investors increased its stake in Concho Resources by 7.1% in the fourth quarter. Capital World Investors now owns 13,270,006 shares of the company’s stock valued at $1,232,253,000 after buying an additional 878,000 shares in the last quarter. A number of other equities research analysts have also issued reports on the company. Zacks Investment Research lowered Concho Resources from a buy rating to a hold rating in a research note on Monday, August 15th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. increased their price target on Concho Resources from $127.00 to $138.00 and gave the stock an overweight rating in a research note on Monday, August 15th. Citigroup Inc. increased their price target on Concho Resources from $143.00 to $150.00 and gave the stock a buy rating in a research note on Thursday, August 11th. Jefferies Group reiterated a hold rating on shares of Concho Resources in a research note on Thursday, August 11th. Finally, Deutsche Bank AG increased their price target on Concho Resources from $140.00 to $150.00 and gave the stock a buy rating in a research note on Wednesday, August 10th. One investment analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, nine have issued a hold rating, twelve have given a buy rating and one has issued a strong buy rating to the company’s stock. Concho Resources presently has an average rating of Buy and an average price target of $131.00. Shares of Concho Resources ( NYSE:CXO ) opened at 134.00 on Tuesday. The company’s market cap is $17.50 billion. The stock has a 50 day moving average price of $124.35 and a 200-day moving average price of $112.16. Concho Resources has a 1-year low of $69.94 and a 1-year high of $137.40. Concho Resources (NYSE:CXO) last issued its quarterly earnings results on Tuesday, August 2nd. The company reported $0.26 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping the Zacks’ consensus estimate of ($0.01) by $0.27. The business earned $396.30 million during the quarter, compared to analysts’ expectations of $482.50 million. During the same quarter in the previous year, the company posted $0.38 EPS. The company’s quarterly revenue was down 26.3% on a year-over-year basis. Equities research analysts forecast that Concho Resources will post $0.17 earnings per share for the current year. Concho Resources Inc is an independent oil and natural gas company engaged in the acquisition, development and exploration of oil and natural gas properties. The Company’s operations are focused in the Permian Basin of Southeast New Mexico and West Texas, an onshore oil and natural gas basin in the United States. Concho Resources Inc. Concho Resources Inc.
